borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed development, by reason of its&nbsp;scale, massing, depth, and&nbsp;siting on the boundary represents&nbsp;would&nbsp;represent&nbsp;unneighbourly design and it would result in an increased sense of overbearing, a harmful loss of outlook, and undue loss of daylight and sunlight to neighbouring property at&nbsp;No.88&nbsp;East Road, RM6 6YT.&nbsp;The proposal is therefore contrary to:</p><ul><li>Part (f) in Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;(NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);</li><li>Policy D6&nbsp;of the London Plan (March 2021);</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</li><li>Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)<br></li><li>Paragraph 5.3.2 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li></ul>

<p>The proposed development, by reason of its&nbsp;scale, massing, and depth would be disproportionate inappropriate development which would result in a significantly larger dwelling that would be out of character with the area, harmful to the appearance of the dwellinghouse and the street scene.&nbsp;The proposal is therefore contrary to:</p><ul><li>Paragraph 134&nbsp;of the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);</li><li>Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</li><li>Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011); and</li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021).</li></ul>
description: Demolition of existing rear extension and construction of a single storey rear extension
